Get ready for an exhilarating day of running and community spirit at the Henley River Half Marathon, 10K & Junior Race, taking place on Saturday, April 11th, 2026, in the beautiful town of Henley-on-Thames, Oxfordshire. Organised by RunThrough Events, this exciting race event promises an unforgettable experience for runners of all levels. Participants can choose from the stunning Half Marathon, the engaging 10K, or the fun Junior Race, all set against the scenic backdrop of the River Thames. 
 
Starting and finishing at the iconic Temple Island Meadows—known for its association with the Royal Henley Rowing Regatta—this mixed-terrain course features undulating trails and breathtaking landscapes. The Half Marathon kicks off at 09:00 am, followed by the 10K at 09:30 am and the Junior Race at 11:30 am. With enthusiastic marshals supporting you along the route and a lively atmosphere to keep you motivated, the Henley River event is a perfect way to welcome spring while supporting the Royal Berks Charity. Don’t miss out on this inspiring day of fitness, fun, and community spirit!

Join us for the World War II Peckham & Dulwich 10k Running Tour on Sunday, November 8, 2026, organized by Secret London Runs. This unique event invites runners of all paces to explore the historic impact of World War II on the vibrant neighborhoods of Peckham and Dulwich. Starting at Peckham Rye Station and concluding at Peckham Rye Common, participants will cover a distance of 10 kilometers (6 miles) while learning about the area's significant contributions to the war effort. 
 
This engaging guided tour, led by the knowledgeable Vanessa, promises an enriching experience filled with captivating stories from the past. Runners will also receive digital photos and a delightful finish-line snack to celebrate their achievement. Whether you're a seasoned athlete or a beginner, this event ensures that no one gets left behind—everyone will run at a comfortable pace, making it a perfect outing for friends and families alike. Join us for the exhilarating Two Tunnels Railway Races on Sunday, August 16, 2026, in the beautiful city of Bath, Bath and North East Somerset! Organised by Relish Running Races, this unique event promises an unforgettable running experience as participants traverse the longest underground sections for each race distance in the UK. Runners can choose from an exciting lineup of races including the Ultra, Marathon, Half Marathon, 10km, 5km, and a vibrant Colourburst event for all ages. 
 
Set against the stunning backdrop of Bath's attractions, the route takes you through the historic Devonshire Tunnel and the impressive Combe Down Tunnel, both transformed into a well-lit and well-surfaced shared path for everyone to enjoy. The start and finish lines are located at Brickfields Park, a perfect spot for friends and family to cheer you on or relax with a picnic after the race. Plus, by participating, you’ll be supporting Sustrans, as £1 from every runner will go towards maintaining the Two Tunnels. Sign up today and be part of this fantastic community event that celebrates health, heritage, and fun!

Join us for this unforgettable running experience in Bristol, where every mile truly counts!

Experience the thrill of a calm 1.2-mile swim, followed by a challenging 67-mile bike ride through the picturesque rolling Surrey Hills, and finish with a scenic 14-mile trail run across the South Downs.  
 
The Castle to Coast Triathlon is designed for everyone, whether you're a seasoned triathlete or taking on your first event. With a non-competitive sportive format, you can enjoy the beauty of the course alongside friends and fellow participants without the pressure of traditional race rules. Expect fantastic support throughout the event, with well-marked routes, dedicated mechanics, and medical teams ready to assist you at every turn. Plus, transportation back to Windsor is available post-event for your convenience! Don't miss out on this remarkable experience that blends adventure, camaraderie, and stunning scenery. Join Saturn Running for the exhilarating Remembrance Run 2026 on Sunday, November 8th, in the picturesque city of Durham, County Durham. This special event honors our fallen heroes with a touching moment of silence at 11 AM, allowing participants to reflect on the sacrifices made by brave soldiers throughout history. Runners can choose their distance, from a 5km dash to an ultra challenge, all while navigating a beautiful 4.37-mile loop along the scenic River Wear, with stunning views of the iconic Cathedral.

Get ready for the PWR Endure Backyard Ultra Marathon, the biggest ultra marathon in the Southwest! Taking place over an exhilarating 30-hour period from Saturday, May 23, 2026, to Sunday, May 24, 2026, this thrilling event will unfold at the historic grounds of Tockington Manor in Bristol, Avon. Featuring a unique format, runners will tackle a challenging 4.167-mile loop every hour on the hour, with a total distance of 125 miles (201 km) up for grabs. The last person standing will be crowned the ultimate champion, while remaining athletes will compete in a dramatic 'Shot Gun Finish' to determine the top three winners. 
 
PWR Endure invites runners of all levels, from novices to seasoned athletes, to join in this extraordinary experience. Participants should bring their own tents or shelters and be prepared for an unforgettable weekend filled with music, entertainment, and camaraderie. Get ready for an unforgettable experience at the Thames Trail Ultra, taking place on Saturday, October 24, 2026! Organised by Go Beyond, this exhilarating 47-mile ultra-marathon challenges runners to traverse the stunning Thames Path, from the historic town of Iffley near Oxford to the picturesque Henley-on-Thames. This race, previously known as the Thames Trot, is a beloved fixture on the British ultra-running calendar, offering a perfect blend of breathtaking river views, diverse terrain, and vibrant community spirit.  
 
Runners will tackle a mix of smooth paths and muddy trails, all while enjoying the scenic beauty of the Thames River winding through charming villages and traditional rowing clubs. As an officially recognised UTMB Index Race in the 50K category, the Thames Trail Ultra is a must for any serious ultra-runner looking to earn UTMB points. With five well-stocked aid stations along the route, including delicious Go Beyond fruitcake, participants will be fully supported throughout their journey. Celebrate your achievement with trophies for top finishers and exclusive Go Beyond merchandise for all finishers. Don't miss your chance to challenge yourself and create lasting memories on this iconic course! Sign up now to be part of the Thames Trail Ultra adventure!

raw.full_description:
Get ready for the exhilarating Welsh 3 Peaks Race, taking place on Monday, September 21, 2026! Organized by Out-Fit Events, this multi-day continuous race is set against the stunning backdrop of Caernarfon, Llanberis, and the breathtaking Gwynedd mountains. Spanning an incredible 286 kilometers and featuring over 11,000 meters of ascent, this challenging event invites both SOLO competitors and TEAMS of 3 or 6 to tackle the highest peaks in Wales.  
 
Starting from Llanberis at the foot of Yr Wyddfa, participants will embark on a journey that includes the majestic Cadair Idris and culminates at the iconic Pen y Fan, with a triumphant descent to the finish at Storey Arms. With a time limit of 4.5 days (108 hours) and strategic checkpoints offering support, this event promises an unforgettable experience for all adventurers. Whether you’re racing solo or as part of a team, prepare for an adventure that will test your limits and reward your spirit. Don’t miss out on this incredible opportunity to conquer the Welsh mountains!

Get ready for an extraordinary adventure at the Lone Wolf Birmingham 2026, organized by Dynamic Adventures! This thrilling event will take place on Saturday, September 19, 2026, in the stunning Wyre Forest near Kidderminster, Worcestershire. Lone Wolf is not just any race; it’s an ultimate endurance challenge where participants can choose their distance—whether it’s a 10k, half marathon, marathon, or ultra marathon.  
 
Join fellow runners every hour on the hour for a unique 24-hour challenge that tests your limits and spirit. Complete each loop within 60 minutes to continue, and if you finish early, take the time to refuel and prepare for the next lap. The race culminates in an exhilarating showdown on the 24th lap, where only one participant will emerge as the Lone Wolf Champion. With a picturesque backdrop, a supportive community, and the chance to earn handmade wooden trophies and medals, this event promises an unforgettable experience for everyone—from beginners to elite athletes. Don’t miss out on this incredible opportunity to push your boundaries and embrace the beauty of nature. Register now and be part of an event that celebrates resilience and camaraderie!

This unique event takes place in the picturesque city of Bath, Avon, and offers a variety of race distances to suit every runner, including a 50km, Marathon, 25km, Half Marathon, 10km, and a fun-filled 2km Fun Run.  
 
The races follow the historic route of the original train line from Green Park Station in Bath to Bristol Temple Meads, providing a flat, fast course that is 100% tarmac. As you run through beautiful green countryside into the heart of Bristol, you'll encounter fascinating nods to the railway's rich heritage. Experience the thrill of the Half Marathon that takes you to Bitton Train Station, where you'll run alongside the active Avon Valley Railway. The longer distances, including the Marathon and 50km, continue past restored signal boxes and charming stations, culminating in the impressive 450m long Staple Hill Tunnel. This is an inclusive event designed for runners and walkers of all abilities, offering a fantastic opportunity to enjoy the scenic beauty of a 5.3k out-and-back course along an old disused train line. With a generous 7-hour time limit to complete your laps, you can take your time and relish the experience. Whether you're aiming to complete just one lap or challenge yourself to 14 laps for an ultra-distance, every participant is celebrated as a finisher and will receive a stunning medal! 
 
With distances ranging from a 5.3k lap to a full marathon (8 laps), this event promises to be a memorable day full of community spirit and personal achievement. Don't miss out on the chance to be part of this exciting event—register early, as places are limited! If capacity is reached, late entrants will receive a bespoke medal from a selection available on the day. Come and discover how far you can go at the Autumn Challenge Day 1!

Get ready for the 2026 Isle of Wight Marathon, an exhilarating celebration of endurance and spirit, taking place on Sunday, October 4th, 2026, at 11:00 AM! Organized by Ryde Harriers, this iconic event marks the 70th Men's marathon and the 51st Women's marathon, making it a historic milestone in the world of running. The marathon features a scenic single-lap course that showcases the beautiful landscapes of the Isle of Wight, winding through charming towns and picturesque rural areas. 
 
This year promises to be extra special as the Isle of Wight Marathon is recognized as one of the longest-running marathons in the UK and even the world, having started in 1957. With a participant limit of 400 runners, enthusiasts of all levels are encouraged to join in the fun! Whether you're a seasoned athlete or a first-time marathoner, this event is a fantastic opportunity to challenge yourself and celebrate the joy of running. Make sure to mark your calendars and secure your entry before the closing date on September 27th, 2026. Don’t miss out on the chance to be part of this historic marathon with Ryde Harriers!

Get ready for an unforgettable adventure at the Runningmonks Rollin' 100, taking place on Saturday, July 25, 2026, in the picturesque town of Bishops Castle, Shropshire! Hosted by Runningmonk Trail Events, this exhilarating 100-mile race promises an incredible journey through the stunning landscapes of three counties. Participants will navigate a continuous loop that showcases the breathtaking Shropshire Way, Mortimer Trail, and Offa's Dyke, all while gaining a challenging 16,500 feet in elevation.  
 
Whether you’re a seasoned ultra-runner or a passionate trail enthusiast, the Rollin' 100 offers a unique opportunity to experience the beauty of nature as you traverse trails, forests, and fields. Each runner will be equipped with a tracker to keep friends and family updated on your progress, and you'll receive a finisher's buckle, T-shirt, buff, and access to fully stocked vegan-friendly aid stations to fuel your journey. With supportive volunteers and facilities at Bishops Castle Rugby Club, this event is not to be missed! Make plans to join us for a day of camaraderie, challenge, and celebration in the heart of Shropshire!

raw.full_description:
Get ready for an unforgettable adventure at the Race The Sun Cheddar Gorge, proudly organized by Action Medical Research! On Saturday, July 11th, 2026, join us in the stunning Cheddar, Somerset, for an exhilarating team challenge that will take you through the breathtaking scenery of the iconic Cheddar Gorge. This triathlon-style event invites teams of two or four to bike, hike, and paddle from dawn until dusk, all while racing the sun and raising funds for a great cause. 
 
Participants will embark on a thrilling 32-mile bike ride that meanders through picturesque villages and features the spectacular ascent of Cheddar Gorge. Afterward, lace up your hiking boots for a challenging yet rewarding 9-mile hike, offering panoramic views and steep climbs that promise to leave you in awe. Finally, take to the waters of Cheddar Reservoir for a fun and accessible 2-mile canoeing adventure—no prior experience required!  
 
Celebrate your accomplishments with fellow adventurers at the event hub, where delicious food and drinks await. Taking place from Saturday, July 11th to Sunday, July 12th, 2026, this thrilling event will be held in the stunning surroundings of Caernarfon, Gwynedd, at the base of the iconic Yr Wyddfa (Snowdon), the highest mountain in England and Wales, towering at 1,085 meters (3,560 feet).  
 
Participants will have the opportunity to take on the challenge of ascending and descending Snowdon as many times as possible within 24 hours, either solo or as part of a team. Categories include solo runners, pair relays, and team relays (up to 5 members), with a unique timing system that allows only one team member to run at a time. Join us for this unforgettable adventure in the breathtaking beauty of Snowdonia and make your mark in this extraordinary race!

Get ready for an unforgettable cycling adventure at the Moor to Sea & Dartmoor Legend, taking place on Saturday, July 11, 2026, in the picturesque Exeter, Kennford, Devon. Organized by Sportiva Events, this exciting event promises to showcase some of the best riding that Devon has to offer, featuring stunning coast road sections and the iconic climbs of Dartmoor, including the famous Haytor.  
 
Participants can choose from four fantastic routes designed to challenge cyclists of all levels. The Inspire route spans 34 miles (57 km) with a 2,300 ft ascent, perfect for those looking for a shorter ride. The Challenge route covers 64 miles (103 km) with a 5,700 ft ascent for those seeking a medium-distance challenge. For the seasoned cyclists, the Extreme route offers a thrilling 110-mile (178 km) journey with nearly 10,000 ft of ascent. Finally, the ultimate test awaits with the Legend route, an ultra distance of 200 miles (320 km) and a staggering 20,000 ft of ascent.  
 
Participants will enjoy a fully marked course, well-stocked feed stations, quality cotton T-shirts for early entries, medals for all finishers, and professional chip timing.

Get ready for an exhilarating weekend at Gravel Rocks, the ultimate summer gravel riding and trail running festival, hosted by Focal Events! Taking place from Friday, July 10th to Sunday, July 12th, 2026, in the stunning Duncombe Park Estate in York, North Yorkshire, this multi-day event promises an unforgettable experience for adventure enthusiasts of all levels.  
 
Participants will navigate world-class off-road trails while tackling timed segments that remain a mystery until they hit the course, adding an exciting twist to the competition. Whether you're an experienced athlete or just starting your off-road journey, Gravel Rocks caters to everyone, offering various distances and challenges that blend the thrill of competition with the joy of camaraderie. Beyond the trails, the festival atmosphere is alive with delicious food, refreshing drinks, live music, and entertainment, creating a vibrant hub to share stories and celebrate the spirit of adventure. Join us at Gravel Rocks and immerse yourself in a weekend full of excitement, connection, and the sheer joy of trail sports!

raw.title: Jurassic Coast Challenge | 75-miles | 3-days
raw.desc_preview: Join us for the exhilarating Jurassic Coast Challenge, a thrilling 75-mile trek that spans over three unforgettable days from July 10 to July 12, 2026. Organized by Endurotrek, this iconic adventure...
raw.full_description:
Join us for the exhilarating Jurassic Coast Challenge, a thrilling 75-mile trek that spans over three unforgettable days from July 10 to July 12, 2026. Organized by Endurotrek, this iconic adventure takes you along the breathtaking Jurassic Coast from Abbotsbury to the stunning finish at Studland Bay in Weymouth, Dorset. Experience towering cliffs, hidden coves, and panoramic sea views as you conquer one of the UK's most challenging endurance treks. 
 
The journey kicks off in Abbotsbury, where you'll embark on a 25-mile adventure to Lulworth Cove, followed by another day of scenic beauty as you trek from Lulworth to Kimmeridge. On the final day, push through to Studland Bay, celebrating your achievement against the backdrop of the English Channel. With three entry categories—ENJOY, ENDEAVOUR, and ENDURE—there's a perfect option for everyone, whether you're looking for a leisurely pace or a full expedition challenge. With fully supported checkpoints and new accommodations for 2026, this is an event you won't want to miss. Sign up today and get ready for an unforgettable journey!
		 
		 Read more

On Friday, July 10, 2026, at 18:30, runners will gather at the picturesque Rye Harbour Nature Reserve in East Sussex for an unforgettable evening of racing. Participants can choose between a 10k or 5k race, along with a fun 1k Junior Run, making it a perfect event for families and runners of all levels. 
 
This series offers a unique opportunity to race through one of Britain’s cherished conservation sites, featuring stunning coastal landscapes that include interlocking shingle ridges, saltmarshes, and saline lagoons. The flat and fast course promises the possibility of quick times, particularly if the conditions are favorable. The Rye Summer Classic Series is renowned for its friendly atmosphere and vibrant race day vibes, ensuring a memorable experience for everyone involved. Don't miss out on the chance to earn a bespoke medal and enjoy the thrill of racing in such a beautiful setting!

raw.title: Thursley 10km
raw.desc_preview: Join us for the exhilarating Thursley 10km event on Tuesday, July 7th, 2026, hosted by Running Adventures in the picturesque town of Godalming, Surrey. This unique race offers participants a chance...
raw.full_description:
Join us for the exhilarating Thursley 10km event on Tuesday, July 7th, 2026, hosted by Running Adventures in the picturesque town of Godalming, Surrey. This unique race offers participants a chance to explore the breathtaking trails of Thursley National Nature Reserve, one of the largest remaining fragments of heathland in the region, spanning an impressive 325 hectares.  
 
The Thursley 10km is an ideal opportunity for trail running first-timers, featuring the flattest terrain offered by Running Adventures. Runners will have the chance to navigate scenic trails, including the acclaimed boardwalk, recently recognized as 'Britain's Favourite Path'. As you embark on this unforgettable journey, you'll be surrounded by the vibrant wildlife of the reserve, which is home to 20 species of dragonflies and damselflies, as well as a delightful variety of birds such as Dartford warblers and long-tailed tits. Whether you're a seasoned runner or looking to connect with fellow enthusiasts, the Thursley 10km promises an uplifting and enjoyable experience amidst nature’s beauty. Don't miss out on this fantastic event!
		 
		 Read more

Get ready for a day of fun, laughter, and purpose at the Race for Life Crawley Pretty Muddy 5k, organized by Cancer Research UK - Race for Life! On Saturday, July 18, 2026, join us in Crawley, West Sussex, for an exhilarating 5k obstacle course that invites you to climb, crawl, and slide your way to the finish line at your own pace. This event is all about having a blast while supporting a vital cause, as participants can expect to get wonderfully muddy while raising money for life-saving cancer research. 
 
Whether you choose to tackle the course solo or gather your friends and family for a day of unforgettable memories, the Pretty Muddy® experience is designed for everyone. With no pressure to finish in a specific time, you can expect to enjoy the journey and embrace your inner child. Don't miss out on this fantastic opportunity to make a difference while having a great time! Join us for the Race for Life Crawley Pretty Muddy 5k and help us fight cancer one muddy step at a time!

The Castle to Castle Ultra isn't just a race; it's a celebration of athleticism and exploration, providing an exceptional opportunity to immerse yourself in the enchanting history that surrounds these iconic landmarks. Join us for an unforgettable weekend at the BigHeat "CAMP-FIRE," part of the Classic Element Trail Series, organized by BigFeat Events! This exhilarating trail running festival will take place from Saturday, July 18th to Sunday, July 19th, 2026, in the picturesque village of Lurgashall, Petworth, West Sussex. Embrace the thrill of the outdoors with a choice of distances, including the challenging 50km Ultramarathon and Marathon on Saturday, followed by the 16-mile and 12km races on Sunday. Families can also enjoy the LittleFeat Flower Trail, a delightful 2km fun run through stunning wildflower meadows. 
 
Set against the backdrop of the beautiful Surrey Hills, the event features scenic trails along The Serpent Trail, with winding paths that showcase the breathtaking landscapes of Blackdown and The Temple of the Winds. Beyond the races, participants can relax in the vibrant event village, enjoy live music, partake in yoga sessions, and unwind with massages and a wild sauna. Camping options are available, making it the perfect weekend escape for trail running enthusiasts and families alike! Don’t miss out on this incredible adventure—mark your calendars for an unforgettable experience with BigFeat Events!

Get ready for an exhilarating day of cycling at the Vale Brewery Sportive, hosted by Letsgovelo on Saturday, July 18th, 2026. This exciting event takes place in the picturesque Buckingham countryside, offering riders a delightful journey through charming old English villages. Cyclists can choose between two fantastic race distances: the Half Pint route at 35 miles (56 km) and the Full Pint route at 56 miles (90 km). Both routes are designed with fewer undulations, making it a perfect opportunity for cyclists of all levels to enjoy the scenic views while challenging themselves.  
 
Starting at 9:00 am from the Vale Brewery at Tramway Business Park, Ludgershall Road, Brill, Buckinghamshire, participants can look forward to a well-supported ride, complete with refreshment stops and mechanical assistance. Plus, every rider will be treated to a complimentary Vale Brewery ale upon finishing, because what better way to celebrate your achievement than with a refreshing drink? With on-site parking available and entry on the day if spots remain, the Vale Brewery Sportive promises a fun and memorable day out for cycling enthusiasts. Don't miss this chance to join fellow cyclists in a celebration of fitness and community!

Get ready for an unforgettable day of athleticism and community spirit at the ATW Bristol Triathlon on Sunday, July 12, 2026! This exciting event takes place in the vibrant city of Bristol, renowned for its culture and stunning green spaces. Athletes of all levels are invited to participate in one of the UK's most popular closed-road triathlons, starting with a refreshing swim in the picturesque Cumberland Basin. Following the swim, competitors will enjoy a traffic-free bike ride on the scenic Portway, passing under the iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge. The event culminates with a memorable run alongside the beautiful River Avon. 
 
Participants can choose between two race distances: the Sprint distance featuring a 750m swim, 21km bike, and 5km run, and the Standard distance with a 1500m swim, 42km bike, and 10km run. For those who prefer a different challenge, the Aquabike option (Swim-Bike) is available for both distances, and teams can sign up for a relay in the Standard distance. Organized by ATW, this event promises a well-marked course, supportive marshals, and finish line goodies. Plus, you can contribute to a great cause by raising funds

Whether you're a seasoned marathoner, aiming for a personal best, or just looking to enjoy the great outdoors with friends, this event has something for everyone! 
 
Participants can choose from three exciting race options: a full marathon, a half marathon, and the newly introduced Mini Rasselbock. The half marathon features a picturesque 13.1-mile loop through the tranquil forest, while the full marathon challenges you to conquer this loop twice. For those not quite ready for the longer distances, the Mini Rasselbock offers an approachable 8.6km loop that still showcases the beauty of the area. With generous cutoff times—7 hours for the half marathon, 8 hours for the marathon, and 2.5 hours for the Mini—every runner, regardless of experience, is encouraged to take on their personal challenge.

raw.full_description:
Get ready for an exhilarating experience at the Lyme Half Marathon, organized by BigFeat Events, taking place on Sunday, July 5th, 2026. Set against the breathtaking backdrop of Lyme, National Trust in Cheshire, this Gold Award-Winning half marathon promises an unforgettable adventure through stunning landscapes and challenging trails. Runners will embark on a picturesque route that starts and finishes in the scenic grounds of Lyme Hall, navigating the famous Gritstone Trail, climbing the impressive Kerridge Ridge, and enjoying a flatter stretch along the Macclesfield Canal. 
 
Participants can look forward to a well-marked course with two fully stocked aid stations, ensuring they stay energized throughout the race. The event is designed for both seasoned runners and newcomers alike, with a friendly atmosphere that makes it a must-attend occasion. Each finisher will receive a bespoke medal, and those interested in sustainability can opt for a tree to be planted in their honor instead. With registration starting at 7:00 AM and the half marathon kicking off at 8:00 AM, this event is set to be a highlight of the summer running calendar! Don’t miss out on the chance to be part of this fantastic event filled with incredible views, enthusiastic volunteers, and a vibrant community spirit

Get ready to lace up your running shoes for a truly unique experience at the World Cup Winners 60th Anniversary Marathon, organized by Enigma Running! On Sunday, July 5, 2026, join fellow enthusiasts in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, to celebrate the iconic victory of England’s 1966 World Cup team. This fun-themed marathon offers a scenic route featuring firm trail lakeside laps on a traffic-free course, making it perfect for runners of all levels.  
 
With only 66 exclusive spots available, every finisher will be awarded a bespoke medal that replicates the original medal given to legends like Bobby Moore and Geoff Hurst. Don’t miss out on this once-in-a-lifetime event, complete with a large free car park and a welcoming pub at the finish line. Mark your calendars and prepare to celebrate sporting history while enjoying a fantastic day of running!

raw.full_description:
Join us for the exhilarating Bridge Triathlon, organized by Bridge Events Dartford, on Sunday, July 5th, 2026! Set against the stunning backdrop of one of the cleanest lakes in South England, this triathlon promises an unforgettable experience for athletes of all levels. Participants can choose from a variety of race distances, including the super sprint, sprint, and standard distances, along with a team relay option. The event features a 1500m swim, 42km bike ride, and 10km run for the standard distance, while the sprint offers a 750m swim, 24km bike, and 5km run. For those looking for a shorter challenge, the GO TRI distance includes a 400m swim, 14km bike, and 3.3km run.  
 
The race kicks off bright and early at 6:30 am, with waves starting every 15 minutes to ensure a smooth and enjoyable experience. Plus, don't miss the chance to participate in the Aqua Bike race, where you can enjoy the swimming and cycling without the run! With a focus on creating a welcoming atmosphere for newcomers to the sport, the Bridge Triathlon is the perfect opportunity to dive into the world of triath

raw.full_description:
Get ready for an exhilarating day of athletic competition at the English Riviera Triathlon, hosted by Sportiva Events on Sunday, July 5th, 2026! This exciting event takes place in the stunning surroundings of Devon, featuring the only closed road triathlon in the region. Athletes can choose from a variety of race distances, including the Standard distance with a non-drafting format, and a Sprint distance that will be run as a thrilling drafting race. The bike course is designed for speed, consisting of a flat 5-kilometre closed road lap, with participants completing eight laps for the Standard distance and four laps for the Sprint distance.  
 
In addition to these races, there will also be Supersprint, Tristar 3, and Tristar 2 events, ensuring there’s something for everyone! Each race is professionally timed, and all finishers will receive a medal, a silicone swim hat, and an English Riviera t-shirt or beanie hat. With fully marked and marshalled courses, along with water and energy drinks provided at feed stations in biodegradable cups, this event emphasizes both safety and sustainability. Don’t miss your chance to be part of this vibrant celebration of sportsmanship and community on the picturesque Devon coast!
		 
		 Read more

Get ready for an unforgettable running experience at The Rasselbock Run – Summer 2026, organized by Rasselbock Running! Taking place on Sunday, July 5th, 2026, in the picturesque Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, this exciting event offers a unique six-hour challenge on a beautiful looped trail course through the stunning Sherwood Pines Forest. Participants can take on as many laps as they desire, with each lap measuring 5.76 km. Whether you aim to conquer just one lap, complete a half marathon with four laps, a full marathon with eight, or even push the limits for an Ultra with nine laps or more, the choice is entirely yours!  
 
At Rasselbock Running, we believe in creating a relaxed and friendly atmosphere for all runners, featuring a small entry pool that encourages camaraderie among participants. There’s no pressure or stress – just the joy of running surrounded by a great community. You can even decide on the day how far you want to run, making it the perfect event for all fitness levels. Join us this summer for a memorable day filled with fun, fitness, and fantastic scenery!

raw.desc_preview: Get ready for the adventure of a lifetime at the Hadrian's Wall Challenge, organized by Endurotrek! From Friday, June 26 to Sunday, June 28, 2026, join us in Carlisle, Cumbria, as we embark on an...
raw.full_description:
Get ready for the adventure of a lifetime at the Hadrian's Wall Challenge, organized by Endurotrek! From Friday, June 26 to Sunday, June 28, 2026, join us in Carlisle, Cumbria, as we embark on an exhilarating 80-mile trek along the historic Hadrian's Wall. This three-day challenge will have you averaging a marathon distance each day, inviting participants to embrace the breathtaking landscapes and rich history of this ancient Roman fortification. 
 
Whether you're a casual trekker or a seasoned adventurer, the Hadrian's Wall Challenge offers three entry categories to suit all levels of fitness and ambition: Enjoy, Endeavour, and Endure. With the support of the Endurotrek team, you'll benefit from regular checkpoints, pre-designated campsites with hot showers, and all the amenities you need to recharge after each day's journey. Along the way, you'll traverse rugged terrains, picturesque countryside, and fascinating archaeological sites, creating unforgettable memories as you complete this remarkable challenge. All participants will receive a stylish challenge t-shirt and medal upon finishing, making this an event you won't want to miss!
		 
		 Read more

raw.full_description:
Get ready for an exhilarating weekend of gravel riding at Grinduro Scotland, set to take place on Friday, June 26, 2026, at the stunning Drumlanrig Castle in Thornhill, Dumfries and Galloway! Organised by Outsider Events, this event promises an unforgettable experience, blending challenging trails with breathtaking landscapes in the heart of the Queensberry Estate. As part of the South Scotland Outdoor Festival, participants can look forward to an action-packed itinerary filled with rides, inspiring talks, captivating films, live music, wellness sessions, and much more. 
 
Kick off the festivities on Friday with site opening at 14:00, followed by registration and engaging talks at 17:00. The excitement continues on Saturday with the main Grinduro Ride starting at 09:00, along with the family-friendly Grindurito Ride at 10:00. To wrap up the weekend, join the Hangover Shake-Out Ride on Sunday morning before the site closes at 18:00. With limited entries and high demand, securing your spot early is essential for what promises to be three days of adventure, community, and pure joy at one of the most iconic gravel riding venues in the world. Don’t miss out on this incredible celebration

raw.full_description:
Get ready for an exhilarating challenge at the Kent Backyard Ultra - Bedgebury, taking place on Friday, June 26, 2026, at the stunning Bedgebury National Pinetum & Forest in Kent! Organised by Hellfire Events Ltd, this event invites runners of all levels to test their endurance in a unique format where participants run a 4.167-mile loop every hour on the hour. The goal? To complete each loop within 60 minutes and return to the starting corral to go again, until only one runner remains – the Last One Standing! 
 
This is the fourth and final round of the 2025/26 Kent Backyard Ultra Series, a thrilling journey that has seen runners tackle various scenic locations. The Bedgebury course features wide, gravel forest trails with a gentle 305ft (93m) ascent per loop, designed to challenge you without overwhelming your spirit. Whether you aim to run one loop or push for the coveted gold buckle, you’ll find camaraderie and support among fellow runners as you share this unforgettable experience. With a cap of 120 runners and entry open to anyone aged 16 and over, this is an excellent opportunity to be part of a vibrant running community. Sign up today, and

raw.full_description:
Get ready for an exhilarating experience at the Dartmouth Triathlon, hosted by Sportiva Events on Sunday, June 7th, 2026! Celebrating its 12th year, this exciting triathlon promises an unforgettable day of athleticism set against the stunning backdrop of Blackpool Sands. Participants will kick off the event with a refreshing swim in the crystal-clear waters, followed by a scenic bike ride on Devon’s flattest roads through the picturesque village of Slapton. Rounding out the race, athletes will enjoy a beautiful out-and-back run along the charming Blackpool Valley Road. 
 
With limited spots available—only 350 entries for the triathlon—early registration is highly recommended to secure your place in this popular event. Don't miss the chance to participate in our increasingly popular sea swims on Saturday evening, offering 750m, 1500m, and 3K distances. Plus, enjoy the unique opportunity to camp on the beach for a small additional fee! Each participant will receive a quality t-shirt, swim hat, and a medal upon finishing, along with full water safety support from Teignmouth Beach Surf Life Saving Club. Join us for an incredible day of fitness, community, and fun!
		 
		 Read more

Get ready for an unforgettable adventure at The Llangollen 50k, organized by Out-Fit Events! Taking place on Saturday, June 6th, 2026, this spectacular ultra-distance race will showcase the breathtaking beauty of Llangollen, Clwyd, nestled in the stunning Dee Valley of North Wales. Participants will embark on a challenging yet rewarding journey, traversing two scenic 15-mile routes along the river, with a little extra distance to complete the magical 50k. 
 
With over 6,000 feet of ascent, runners will enjoy awe-inspiring views as they make their way to the summit of Moel Fferna, standing at an impressive 2,071 feet. This event is perfect for both seasoned ultra runners and those looking to take their first steps into the world of ultra racing. You'll have the opportunity to take your time, soak in the stunning scenery, and connect with fellow runners along the way. With three well-stocked checkpoints to keep you fueled and motivated, plus a celebratory medal awaiting you at the finish line, The Llangollen 50k promises to be a day to remember. So mark your calendars and prepare for an exhilarating experience in the heart of Wales!

Organised by UK Cycling Events, this cycling extravaganza promises to be an unforgettable experience for riders of all levels. Choose from the Long or Middle Route, which features the legendary Leith Hill, the highest point in Southern England at 294 meters, and the challenging ascent of Box Hill for those on the Long Route. If you're new to cycling, the Short Route, spanning just over 50km with 500 meters of climbing, is the perfect introduction to the breathtaking beauty of the Surrey Hills, an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. 
 
No matter which route you tackle, prepare to be captivated by the diverse landscapes, from rolling chalk downs and vibrant grasslands to lush woodlands and scenic heaths. Upon crossing the finish line, celebrate your achievement with a well-deserved medal and delightful goodies from our sponsors. The lively post-race village offers the perfect atmosphere to relax and mingle with fellow cyclists while enjoying delicious pizza and great company. Participants can look forward to a challenging yet rewarding day and night of trail running, offering stunning views that stretch for miles.  
 
Whether you’re a seasoned runner or just looking to step out of your comfort zone, the Bat Challenge provides a fantastic opportunity to try night trail running. Start your adventure in the warmth of the late spring sun and, if you choose, continue into the enchanting dusk and darkness. The flexible format allows you to run a lap or two in daylight, take a break, and then head out for a thrilling night lap. With support available every 5k, you'll have the confidence to explore the trails, even as the sun sets. Just remember, anyone starting after 7 PM will need to carry a head torch for safety. Get ready for an exhilarating day of athleticism at the Tavistock Triathlon, set to take place on Sunday, May 3rd, 2026! Organized by Sportiva Events, this exciting triathlon will be hosted at the stunning Mount Kelly, featuring an impressive 50m Olympic-standard swimming pool. Participants will dive into the crystal-clear waters before embarking on a scenic bike course that winds through quiet, rolling roads. The final leg of the race takes runners along a peaceful lane and a picturesque section of the old railway line, ensuring a memorable experience for all. 
 
Athletes of all levels will enjoy a fantastic atmosphere, complete with finishers medals for everyone and special podium awards for top performers. Competitors will also receive quality silicone swim hats, secure transition areas, and professional first aid support. The transition area and Tristars bike and run routes are nestled within the beautiful grounds of Mount Kelly College, making this event not just a race, but a celebration of fitness and community. Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to challenge yourself and enjoy a day filled with fun and camaraderie!

Get ready for an unforgettable experience at The Dun Holm Challenge 2026, hosted by Saturn Running on Thursday, May 21, 2026, in the picturesque Durham, County Durham! This exciting event offers a 7-hour Time Challenge where participants can choose their own adventure with a minimum distance of just 3km, while full laps cover 4.37 miles or 7km. Whether you're a seasoned runner or just starting out, this event welcomes all abilities and even walkers. The scenic route along the River Wear features stunning views of the iconic Durham Cathedral, making it a perfect day out for everyone! 
 
Participants have the option to sign up for all five days or tackle the event individually, with the added bonus of a commemorative t-shirt for those who enroll for the complete challenge. With an early bird price starting at just £110 for affiliated runners, The Dun Holm Challenge is an incredible opportunity to take on a new personal goal while enjoying a vibrant community atmosphere. Plus, every finisher will receive a fantastic themed medal and a goody bag filled with delicious snacks. Don’t miss your chance to be part of this amazing event on May 21st – register now and get ready to run your way through the heart of Durham!

raw.full_description:
Get ready to experience the excitement of the Storm The Castle Duathlon, happening on Sunday, May 17th, 2026, in the breathtaking setting of Ludlow, Shropshire. Organised by Andali Events, this unique race will take place entirely within the historic grounds of Ludlow’s medieval castle, offering participants an unforgettable atmosphere that combines heritage with adventure.  
 
The duathlon features two thrilling distances, ensuring there's something for everyone. The Full Storm includes a challenging 10km run, followed by a 33km bike ride, and finishes with another 5km run. For those seeking a shorter challenge, the Sprint Storm offers a 5km run, a 23km bike ride, and a final 2.5km run. Additionally, the Radnor Rascal Junior Storm invites younger participants under 13 years to join in the fun with a 1km fun run, making this event a fantastic family-friendly experience. Don’t miss your chance to be part of this legendary race—mark your calendar and prepare to conquer the castle! Will you be #leftinruins? Remember, all participants must be members of British Triathlon to take part, so make sure to secure your membership in advance.

Get ready for an exhilarating day of athleticism and community spirit at The Dorchester Sprint Triathlon, organized by BustinSkin Events! On Sunday, May 24, 2026, participants will gather in the picturesque setting of Poundbury for a thrilling race that promises both challenge and fun. Kick off the event with a 300m pool swim, followed by a scenic 21k bike ride through rolling roads and breathtaking views from the summit of Hardy's Monument. Finally, lace up your running shoes for a 5k run around the Great Field, known for its spectator-friendly atmosphere.  
 
This event is perfect for triathlon enthusiasts looking to start or finish their season on a high note, with races held twice a year in May and October. Make sure to arrive early, as registration opens at 5:30 AM and closes at 6:30 AM, with the race starting promptly at 7:00 AM. So don’t miss out on the chance to be part of this vibrant community event—register early to secure your spot and join in the excitement!

Get ready for an unforgettable running experience at The Valley of the Owls Run, organized by Zig Zag Running on Sunday, June 7, 2026! Set in the picturesque village of Ousden, Bury St Edmunds in Suffolk, this event invites runners of all levels to participate in a variety of race distances, including a 5k, 10k, Half Marathon, Full Marathon, or Ultra Marathon. The scenic course will take you through some of the oldest roads in England, showcasing the stunning countryside that the Valley of the Owls is known for.

The hiking trail promises an adventure for all nature enthusiasts as you meander along the picturesque Wall Side Plantation, ascend to Sugar Hill for panoramic views, and explore the iconic sets of Emmerdale. You’ll also enjoy the tranquility of the Eccup Reservoir, West Yorkshire's largest body of water, surrounded by rich biodiversity. As you navigate through enchanting woodlands, the sights and sounds of nature will accompany you, culminating in a fulfilling finish back at Harewood House. Complete the hike to earn a commemorative medal and a special prize, making this event not just a hike, but a memorable journey through the heart of nature and history. This exciting event features a variety of race distances, including a Sprint Distance (750m Swim, 20k Bike, 5k Run) and a Standard Distance (1500m Swim, 40k Bike, 10k Run), alongside the Aqua Bike and Team Relay options for those who prefer teamwork and a focus on the swim and bike segments.

Get ready for an unforgettable day at the WEST YORKSHIRE TRAIL RUN, organized by UK Running Events, taking place on Sunday, June 21, 2026, in the picturesque setting of Harewood, Leeds, West Yorkshire. This exhilarating event invites runners to experience the breathtaking beauty of the Harewood House estate, a stunning 18th-century residence nestled within over 100 acres of lush woodlands, beautifully landscaped gardens, and serene lakeside views. 
 
Participants will embark on a scenic journey that includes the Harewood House Half Marathon, showcasing a variety of captivating landscapes. Runners will navigate along the winding tracks of Wall Side Plantation, ascend to the picturesque Sugar Hill, and enjoy the tranquil Eccup Reservoir, West Yorkshire's largest body of water. With the added charm of passing the iconic Emmerdale sets and immersing themselves in nature’s splendor, this event is perfect for both seasoned athletes and nature lovers alike. As you cross the finish line, you’ll be celebrated with a medal and a special prize, marking your achievement in this remarkable adventure. Don’t miss out on this perfect blend of athleticism and natural beauty at the WEST YORKSHIRE TRAIL RUN!

Get ready for an exhilarating day of fitness and fun at the Stanley Park 5k & 10k, organized by RunThrough Events! Join us on Saturday, June 20th, 2026, in the beautiful Stanley Park, located in Liverpool, Merseyside. This stunning Grade II* listed park, nestled between the iconic football grounds of Anfield and Goodison Park, is the perfect backdrop for a day of running and community spirit. 
 
Choose between a challenging 10k or a brisk 5k race, both set against the picturesque scenery of one of Liverpool's largest parks. The 5k race kicks off at 9:00 am, while the 10k follows shortly after at 9:10 am. Expect a friendly atmosphere with dedicated marshals cheering you on as you conquer the tarmac paths, boasting an elevation of 43m for the 5k and 85m for the 10k. After crossing the finish line, enjoy a lively event village filled with delicious food and drink options, plus some fantastic goodies from our partners! Don’t miss out on this fantastic opportunity to challenge yourself while soaking in the beauty of Stanley Park!

Get ready for an exhilarating evening at the Dorney Lake Evening Triathlon, hosted by RunThrough Events on Wednesday, July 1, 2026! Set against the stunning backdrop of Windsor, Berkshire, this triathlon promises an unforgettable experience at one of the UK's premier Olympic venues. Participants can choose between a Super Sprint triathlon, featuring a 400m swim, a 9.5km bike ride, and a 2.5km run, or a Sprint triathlon, which includes a 750m swim, a 19km bike ride, and a 5km run. For those looking for a different challenge, the Aquabike option allows you to tackle the swim and bike portions only. 
 
With a flat and fast course, Dorney Lake is perfect for athletes aiming for a personal best. Each race will feature clearly marked distances and enthusiastic volunteers to cheer you on every step of the way. Don't miss this fantastic opportunity to race in a vibrant community atmosphere – mark your calendars for July 1st and get ready to dive into the excitement at the Dorney Lake Evening Triathlon!

Known for its flat and fast course, Dorney Lake is the perfect venue for achieving a personal best, whether you're a seasoned athlete or a first-time participant.

Get ready for an exhilarating day of competition at the WILD HORSE BREWING CO. LLANDUDNO TRIATHLON & DUATHLON 2026, taking place on Sunday, June 28, 2026, in the stunning coastal town of Llandudno, Gwynedd. Organised by Always Aim High Events, this exciting event returns for its fourth year, offering athletes a chance to showcase their skills in a beautiful setting.  
 
Participants can look forward to a thrilling course that includes a refreshing swim beneath the iconic Victorian pier, followed by a scenic bike ride along the closed-road route of Marine Drive, which encircles the breathtaking Great Orme. Runners will then complete the experience along the lively Victorian promenade, where enthusiastic spectators will cheer you on, creating an electrifying atmosphere. Whether you're a seasoned triathlete or new to the sport, the WILD HORSE BREWING CO. LLANDUDNO TRIATHLON & DUATHLON promises a memorable day filled with camaraderie and the warm Welsh welcome that Always Aim High Events is known for. Don't miss out on this fantastic opportunity to challenge yourself in one of the UK's most picturesque locations!

Get ready to lace up your running shoes for The Ship Inn Shuffle, an exciting event organized by Itsgrimupnorthrunning, taking place on Sunday, June 28, 2026. This invigorating race offers participants a scenic out-and-back course that begins on the stunning cliffs of Sewerby and winds along the beautiful North Yorkshire coastline, leading you to the breathtaking Flamborough. Choose your challenge with a variety of distances, including a 5k, 10k, half marathon, and marathon, each offering a unique experience through fields, woodlands, and trails.  
 
With a generous 6.5-hour cut-off time for all distances, this event is perfect for both seasoned runners and those looking to enjoy a leisurely day in nature. You'll find feed and drink stations approximately every three miles to keep you hydrated and energized. After crossing the finish line, savor a delicious meal at the Ship Inn or grab a butty from the Blue Savannah van, making it a perfect opportunity to mingle with fellow runners. The Ship Inn Shuffle promises a delightful day out, filled with stunning views, community spirit, and a chance to embrace the joy of running by the seaside!

Get ready for an unforgettable day of running at The Hampshire Hoppit, taking place on Sunday, June 14th, 2026, in the picturesque Basingstoke, Hampshire! Organized by the Basingstoke and Mid Hants Athletics Club, this exciting event features a trio of trail races: a full marathon, a half marathon, and a 10k, all set against the stunning backdrop of the North Downs. Starting and finishing at the iconic Watership Down, participants will enjoy well-marked and marshalled paths that include sections of the famous Wayfarers Walk and the historic Harrow Way. 
 
Renowned for its friendly atmosphere and exceptional support, The Hampshire Hoppit has proudly earned the GOLD award from Racecheck for seven consecutive years. All finishers will be rewarded with unique engraved glasses and a refreshing fill of ‘Hoppit’, a delicious Classic Ale from Loddon Brewery, or a refreshing soft drink if preferred. Plus, every participant will receive a special engraved medal and one of the best Goody Bags in the running world! With no cut-off time for the half marathon and 10k, and a generous 7-hour limit for the marathon, this event is perfect for runners of all levels.

Join us for the exhilarating Uppingham Pool Triathlon, organized by EndorphinSport Ltd, on Sunday, May 31, 2026, at the stunning Uppingham School Sports Centre in Oakham, Leicestershire. This event is set to become one of the most popular pool-based triathlons in the Midlands, featuring an adult race starting at 8 AM and a thrilling Kids Aquathlon kicking off at 2 PM. The day will culminate in a free-of-charge team relay, which is always a highlight and sure to energize the crowd! 
 
With its immaculate 25-meter pool, supportive atmosphere, and breathtaking bike route winding through charming villages and iconic landmarks like the Welland Viaduct, the Uppingham Pool Triathlon promises an unforgettable experience for everyone. Whether you’re a first-timer—where we celebrate over 200 newcomers with special prizes—or a seasoned pro, this event caters to all abilities, ensuring a memorable start to the summer season. Get ready to cross the finish line in style, surrounded by cheering supporters and the electrifying buzz of the event hub. Don’t miss your chance to take home a finisher's medal and create lifelong memories at this remarkable triathlon!

Get ready for an exhilarating challenge at The Ultra Loop Track Challenge, hosted by Resolute Running on the weekend of May 30-31, 2026! Set in the beautiful surroundings of Woodbank Park Athletics Track in Stockport, Cheshire, this unique event invites runners of all levels to test their endurance over 6, 12, or 24 hours. Participants will tackle the 400m track, aiming to complete as many loops as possible within their chosen timeframe. Whether you're looking to set a personal best or simply enjoy the thrill of running, this event promises an unforgettable experience.  
 
Join fellow enthusiasts for the 24-hour event starting at 9 AM on Saturday and concluding at 9 AM on Sunday, or choose the 12-hour challenge from 9 AM to 9 PM. For those looking for a shorter but equally exciting option, the 6-hour events are available in two sessions: the morning from 9 AM to 3 PM and the evening from 3 PM to 9 PM. Every participant will receive a finishing time and a medal to commemorate their achievement. Don’t miss out on this fantastic opportunity to push your limits and celebrate the joy of running!

The race culminates at Ridgeway View Campsite, near Wallingford, offering a perfect backdrop to celebrate your achievement. Whether you're a seasoned ultramarathoner or looking to challenge yourself, The Ridgeway Chase is an event not to be missed! Mark your calendars for this incredible journey through nature's beauty in Berkhamsted, Hertfordshire.

raw.full_description:
Get ready for a fantastic running experience at the Burrator 10K, hosted by Sportiva Events! This exciting race takes place on Saturday, May 30th, 2026, in the breathtaking surroundings of Burrator Reservoir. With a fast and flat route on fully closed roads, this UK Athletics licensed event is perfect for runners of all levels, from seasoned athletes aiming for a personal best to fun runners just looking to enjoy the day. 
 
The race kicks off right on the stunning Dam bridge, offering a picturesque backdrop as participants tackle a complete loop of the reservoir followed by two-thirds of a second loop, all culminating in a total distance of 10K. With only 90 metres of climbing, this course is an ideal opportunity for competitive runners to push their limits, while also being welcoming for beginners. Every finisher will receive a medal, and with professional electronic chip timing, distance markers, and a water station stocked with gels, you’ll have everything you need for a successful race. Don’t miss out on this unforgettable event at Burrator Reservoir!

Get ready for an unforgettable running experience at the Northants Shires & Spires Event, hosted by Go Beyond on Sunday, May 10th, 2026. Nestled in the charming village of Naseby, Northamptonshire—historically known for the Battle of Naseby in 1645—this multi-distance race is perfect for runners of all levels. Participants can choose from an exciting lineup of distances: a 10K, Half Marathon, Three Quarter Marathon (TQM), Marathon, and an exhilarating 35-mile circular Ultra Marathon.  
 
Starting and finishing at the picturesque Naseby Village Hall, runners will traverse a stunning route that showcases the beauty of the Northamptonshire countryside, including iconic landmarks such as Holdenby, Althorp—home to the Spencer family and the final resting place of Princess Diana—and Cottesbrooke. Whether you’re a first-time ultra runner or seeking a shorter challenge, this event promises to be a rewarding adventure. For the first time in 2024, the race will feature full tracking capabilities, allowing both participants and their supporters to stay connected throughout the journey. Mark your calendars for this unique and scenic race, and join us in celebrating the spirit of the Shires & Spires!
		 
		 Read more

The flat and fast course promises an enjoyable experience for runners of all levels, with perfectly marked mile markers and enthusiastic volunteers cheering you on every step of the way. raw.full_description:
Join us for an exciting day of fun and fitness at the Birmingham Running Festival, hosted by RunThrough Events, on Sunday, May 10th, 2026! Set in the stunning Sutton Park, West Midlands, this annual event invites runners of all ages and abilities to step into summer while supporting a fantastic cause—Birmingham Children’s Hospital.  
 
Participants can choose from a variety of race distances, including a Half Marathon at 9:00 AM, a 10K at 9:45 AM, a 5K at 9:55 AM, and a Junior Race at 11:30 AM. Get ready for an exhilarating day on two wheels at the Beast to the East - Cycle Sportive, hosted by BigFeat Events on Sunday, May 10, 2026. This highly anticipated cycling event takes place in the picturesque Meon Valley, renowned for its stunning landscapes and challenging routes. Participants can choose from four exciting distances: a thrilling 100-mile epic ride, an 82-mile long route, a 57-mile medium challenge, or a more relaxed 28-mile option, ensuring there's something for everyone, regardless of experience level. 
 
Starting from Swanmore College, riders will embark on a journey that takes them through breathtaking scenery, including the iconic Butser Hill, where panoramic views of the South Downs National Park await. With fully marked and marshalled routes, well-stocked aid stations, and a unique bespoke medal for all finishers, this event promises an enjoyable and supportive atmosphere. Registration opens at 7:15 AM, and riders will depart in waves between 8:00 AM and 8:30 AM. Join us for a day of adventure, camaraderie, and unforgettable cycling memories at the Beast to the East!

Set in the picturesque town of Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, this exciting event will take place at the Suffolk Running Centre, providing a stunning backdrop for participants. Runners can choose between two fantastic distances: the scenic marathon, featuring the officially measured Kirtling Route, or the captivating half marathon, which will follow the beautiful Windmill Route.

Along the way, you’ll find well-stocked aid stations every 10 kilometers to keep you energized and motivated. Plus, every finisher will receive a bespoke medal to celebrate their achievement! With parking included in your entry fee and a vibrant race atmosphere, the Zig Zag Marathon and Half Marathon is perfect for both seasoned runners and those aiming for their first marathon GFA place. Get ready for an exhilarating cycling experience at The UKCE Jurassic Classic, organized by UK Cycling Events! Scheduled for Saturday, May 16th, 2026, this spectacular event takes place in the charming town of Wareham, Dorset. Cyclists of all levels can choose from three exciting routes, spanning 56 km to a challenging 121 km, that meander through the breathtaking Purbeck Hills and showcase the stunning views of the UNESCO World Heritage Jurassic Coast.  
 
Prepare to push your limits as you tackle challenging climbs, including a notable 1.8 km stretch with a 7% average gradient along the Lulworth Range. Along your journey, you'll encounter iconic historical landmarks such as Lulworth Castle and Corfe Castle, making this ride not only a test of endurance but a feast for the eyes. Each participant will be rewarded with a finisher medal, plus an array of goodies to celebrate your achievement!  
 
With perks like free parking, mechanical and medical support, chip timing, and fully signed routes, the Jurassic Classic ensures a seamless experience. Don’t miss out on the chance to join our rewards scheme for fantastic discounts throughout the year. Sign up today and embark on an unforgettable adventure at The UKCE Jurassic Classic!

Be prepared for an unforgettable adventure filled with camaraderie, determination, and the chance to earn true ultra glory. Join us for an exhilarating day of athleticism at the Seasonal Duathlons, organized by Bridge Events Dartford, taking place on Sunday, April 26, 2026. Set in the vibrant Cyclopark, this event promises a thrilling experience for both seasoned athletes and newcomers alike. Participants can choose from three exciting race formats: the Long-distance Duathlon featuring a 9k run, 30k bike ride, and another 5k run; the Sprint Duathlon with a 5k run, 20k bike, and a final 5k run; or the beginner-friendly TRI-It Duathlon, which includes a 2.5k run, 12.5k bike, and a concluding 2.5k run. 
 
Gates open at 7:30 AM, and registration begins at 8:00 AM in the café area, so be sure to arrive early for a warm-up ride on the traffic-free bike course! The race kicks off at 9:00 AM, and with finishing times expected by 11:00 AM, it's a perfect way to spend your Sunday morning. Participants are required to wear helmets, and rest assured, all races are covered by BTF and public liability insurance

raw.full_description:
Get ready for an exhilarating challenge at The MTC Oxford Ultra, organized by Ultra Running Ltd, on Friday, August 7th, 2026! This stunning 49-mile race takes you through the picturesque landscapes of Oxfordshire, starting from the Travelodge Oxford Abingdon Road. The course reintroduces you to the serene Thames Path, leading you past iconic sites such as Sandford Weir, Culham, and Cholsey. You'll experience the beauty of Moulsford before returning to the riverbank, passing the charming towns of Streatley and Whitchurch-on-Thames. The adventure culminates as you make your way through Purley Park and Tilehurst, ultimately crossing the finish line in the beautiful Henley-on-Thames. 
 
Not only will participants enjoy an unforgettable journey through some of the UK's most scenic areas, but there are also exciting rewards awaiting finishers! The first male and female runners will each receive a bespoke Oxford Ultra Trophy, while all finishers will take home a unique medal as a testament to their achievement. Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to challenge yourself and celebrate the spirit of ultra running in a vibrant and supportive atmosphere!

Get ready for an exhilarating trail running experience at the BigMud Trails event, part of the Classic Element Trail Series, hosted by BigFeat Events! Mark your calendars for Sunday, February 22, 2026, as runners gather at the stunning Queen Elizabeth Country Park in Hampshire for an unforgettable day of adventure. Participants can choose between two challenging distances: a 16-mile run or a full marathon, both featuring breathtaking views and the thrill of navigating the wild and muddy terrain of the Meon Valley. 
 
This year, BigMud celebrates the element of Earth, taking you on an epic journey that includes a climb of 518 feet to the highest point in the South Downs, Butser Hill, not once, but twice! With a friendly and supportive atmosphere, well-stocked aid stations, and the opportunity to enjoy the natural beauty of the South Downs National Park, this event promises to awaken your spirit and inspire your running journey. Whether you're a seasoned marathoner or a passionate trail runner, don’t miss the chance to be part of this fantastic event. Join us for a day filled with challenge, camaraderie, and a sense of accomplishment at BigMud Trails!

Over the years, the Tunbridge Wells Half Marathon has earned a stellar reputation, even being voted the No.2 Half Marathon in the UK by Runners World readers in 2011.  
 
Join the Tunbridge Wells Harriers for a memorable day filled with camaraderie and enthusiasm. With a single lap, road-closed course featuring a notable 300ft ascent at Spring Hill in Fordcombe, this half marathon promises to be both a test of endurance and a delightful journey through scenic landscapes. Each runner will receive a bespoke medal, and trophies will be awarded to top finishers. Get ready for an exhilarating day of running at the Winchester 10K, taking place on Sunday, February 22, 2026, in the beautiful city of Winchester, Hampshire! Organised by Challenging Events, this iconic road race has a rich history dating back to 1983 and has evolved into a thrilling 10K format that attracts over 1,500 enthusiastic runners each year. The race starts outside the historic Winchester Guildhall, right in front of the impressive King Alfred Statue, and features a scenic one-lap route that combines urban landscapes with picturesque countryside parkland. 
 
Participants will enjoy a vibrant atmosphere as they make their way through the charming village of Kingsworthy and back, with the course leading them through Headbourne Worthy before finishing at The North Walls Recreation Centre. The entry fee includes chip timing and an awesome finisher medal, making it a fantastic event for both competitive runners and those looking to enjoy a day of fitness in a stunning setting. With a well-organised schedule, including registration at 07:15 and an official mass start at 08:30, this is an event you won't want to miss. Join us for an unforgettable day of camaraderie, community spirit, and the joy of running!

Get ready to pedal through the picturesque landscapes of Wiltshire at the UKCE Wiltshire Classic, taking place on Saturday, March 14, 2026. Organized by UK Cycling Events, this beloved cycling event promises an unforgettable journey through the stunning Cranborne Chase Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. Riders will set off from the historic Salisbury Racecourse and enjoy one of three scenic routes that meander through charming Saxon villages, including Rockbourne, home to an ancient Roman villa.  
 
Participants will have the chance to explore the rolling roads that cross county lines into Dorset and Hampshire, making this ride a perfect blend of challenge and enjoyment. Whether you're a seasoned cyclist or just starting out, the UKCE Wiltshire Classic offers non-technical routes designed for everyone to relish the beauty of the countryside. As you cross the finish line, you’ll be greeted with a well-deserved finisher medal and exciting goodies from our partners. Join us for a day of cycling, camaraderie, and the joy of being outdoors—all while soaking in the stunning rural scenery. Don’t miss out on this quintessential cycling experience!

Get ready to lace up your running shoes for the exhilarating MTC CYMRUN 26, organized by Ultra Running Ltd! This incredible six-day ultra-race challenge takes place from April 14 to April 19, 2026, traversing the stunning landscapes of Wales. Starting from Holyhead and finishing in Cardiff, the MTC CYMRUN showcases the breathtaking beauty of the Cycle Route 8, with an added stretch to let competitors dip their toes in the sea at Holyhead and a scenic finish at Barry Island Bay.

This exciting 35-mile race takes place on Sunday, April 19, 2026, in the picturesque Merthyr Tydfil, Mid Glamorgan. As part of the MTC CYMRUN, which spans six days of thrilling multi-race events, participants will share the route with fellow CYMRUN competitors, creating a vibrant atmosphere of endurance and camaraderie. 
 
The race kicks off from the Travelodge in Merthyr Tydfil and follows the scenic Cycle Route 8 all the way to Cardiff, before extending to the stunning Barry Island, concluding at Marco's Cafe. Competitors are encouraged to prepare for various weather conditions, as safety is a top priority. With a limit of just 20 entrants for the MTC Y Draig Goch and an additional 20 for the CYMRUN, this event promises an intimate and supportive environment for all participants. Starting and finishing in North Malvern, this scenic route will take you straight up Worcestershire Hill and along the iconic Malvern Ridge. With over 1300m (4400ft) of elevation, you’ll tackle some challenging terrain while enjoying the camaraderie of fellow runners. This isn’t a race, but rather a chance to savor the beauty of nature at a social pace, stopping along the way to capture the incredible vistas. Led by experienced trail runner Matt Buck, this event is perfect for those who can maintain a comfortable pace of 10 min/miles (6 min/km) on the trails. Don’t miss this opportunity to explore the gorgeous Malvern Hills while connecting with other trail enthusiasts!

Get ready for an exhilarating day of running and celebration at the St David's Day Dragon Run 2026! Organised by Saturn Running, this vibrant event takes place on Sunday, March 1, 2026, in the stunning Dare Valley Country Park, Wales. As you commemorate St David, the patron saint of Wales, you can choose your own adventure with a flexible 7-hour Time Challenge. Whether you’re aiming for a minimum distance of 5km or pushing for a full marathon or even an ultra, the course offers beautiful views and well-maintained paths to keep your spirits high. 
 
Participants can complete laps of 4.37 miles (7km), with options ranging from a half marathon (3 laps) to a 50km challenge. Plus, indulge in a fantastic goody bag filled with treats, including a vegan option! With free parking, dedicated aid stations, and the chance to celebrate personal milestones with special race numbers, the St David's Day Dragon Run promises to be an unforgettable experience for runners of all levels. Join us for the exhilarating South Downs Way Ultra Run, hosted by Running Adventures, on Saturday, February 28, 2026. Set against the stunning backdrop of Petersfield, Hampshire, this 30-mile ultra run is designed for both seasoned runners and newcomers eager to experience the thrill of ultra running. The journey begins and ends at the picturesque Harting Down, taking participants through some of the most breathtaking parts of the South Downs Way, including the iconic Beacon Hill, Cocking Down, and the ancient woodlands of Kingley Vale. 
 
Under the expert guidance of Matt Buck, an accomplished ultra runner and Salomon athlete, you'll navigate this hilly yet rewarding course while enjoying the camaraderie of fellow runners. The event promises not just a physical challenge but also an opportunity to learn from Matt and get your running questions answered. As you traverse through charming villages and nature reserves, you'll encounter the majestic twisted yews of Kingley Vale and connect with the serene Sussex border path. Remember, this is not a race; it’s a shared adventure where participants will run together at a comfortable pace. Whether you're a first-timer or an ultra running enthusiast, this event is perfect for anyone looking to embrace the beauty of nature while pushing their limits.

This exciting event takes you on an unforgettable journey around the stunning Chidham Peninsula and along the picturesque harbour-side paths, showcasing breathtaking views of Chichester Harbour, recognized as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.

This brand new guided running tour invites participants to explore the powerful legacy of the Suffragette movement as you jog through the historic streets of west London.  
 
Over the course of 12 kilometers, you'll follow in the footsteps of courageous women who fought tirelessly for women's suffrage. Highlights include visits to the homes of notable activists such as Millicent Fawcett and Elizabeth Garrett Anderson, as well as key sites of the Women's Social and Political Union (WSPU) and significant protests. Led by the passionate Vanessa, the founder of Secret London Runs, this tour ensures no one gets left behind, offering a supportive atmosphere with short walking intervals for those who may need them. Whether you typically run at a sub 11-minute mile pace or prefer a gentler approach, this event promises to be an uplifting journey through history that combines fitness with education and empowerment. Don't miss this opportunity to celebrate women's history while enjoying the camaraderie of fellow runners!

Get ready for an exhilarating adventure at The Winter Green Man Ultra, hosted by Every Mile Counts! Mark your calendars for Saturday, March 7th, 2026, as this exciting event takes place in the beautiful city of Bristol. Participants can choose between two thrilling race distances: the challenging 45-mile ultra and the 30-mile race, both set on the same stunning course with shared checkpoints and a unified finish line. The Winter Green Man Ultra promises a unique experience as runners will tackle the course in an ANTI-CLOCKWISE direction, a departure from the summer event.  
 
The race kicks off early, with the GMU45 starting at 7:00 AM and the GMU30 following at 10:00 AM. Runners who take on both the summer and winter 45-mile events within the same year will earn a prestigious GMU buckle, with four different awards based on cumulative running time. Whether you're a seasoned ultra-runner or a dedicated newcomer, this event is sure to inspire and challenge. Join us in Bristol for a day of camaraderie, achievement, and unforgettable memories!

Get ready for an exhilarating experience at the Silent Pool 10km, hosted by Running Adventures on Tuesday, March 3rd, 2026, in the picturesque setting of Guildford, Surrey. This stunning guided trail run begins and ends at the enchanting Silent Pool, a site rich in history and natural beauty, famously associated with poet Alfred Tennyson and adorned with the lore of a haunting from the 1100s. Runners will traverse some of the most captivating trails, including sections of the North Downs Way and the beautiful forest of Netley Heath, before winding down to the charming village of Shere, where glimpses of film locations from 'The Holiday' and 'Bridget Jones's Diary' await. 
 
Ideal for both newcomers and seasoned trail runners, this event offers a perfect blend of wide trails perfect for conversations and thrilling single track paths for those seeking adventure. Participants will be guided by the knowledgeable Matt Buck, an experienced ultra runner and Salomon ambassador, ensuring a safe and enjoyable experience for all. Leave your worries behind and join us for a day of fun, camaraderie, and exploration in the stunning countryside! Don't miss out on this unforgettable trail running experience at the Silent Pool 10km!

Runners can choose between two thrilling distances: a 5-mile route that takes you on a single lap through the scenic forest or a 10-mile challenge that spans two laps, perfect for those seeking a bit more adventure.

Get ready for an unforgettable adventure at the Ultra X Rwanda, taking place from January 24th to 25th, 2026, in the stunning location of Kinoni, Burera. Organized by Ultra X, this multi-stage ultra marathon offers participants the choice of challenging themselves with either a 110km or a 50km race. Set against the breathtaking backdrop of northern Rwanda, runners will navigate through the picturesque districts of Burera and Musanze, all while surrounded by the majestic Volcanoes National Park and its famous mountain gorillas. 
 
Participants will experience a sensory journey as they traverse gentle hills and valleys, lush coffee and banana fields, and stunning lake peninsulas, all while enjoying the views of Rwanda's five iconic volcanoes: Mt Muhabura, Mt Sabyinyo, Mt Karisimbi, Mt Bisoke, and Mt Gahinga. Beyond the race, competitors have the chance to explore Rwanda's rich culture and history with add-on options like the Tugende Kigali genocide memorial tour and a safari excursion in Akagera National Park. Whether you're a seasoned runner or seeking a unique holiday experience, the Ultra X Rwanda promises an exciting blend of adventure and exploration in one of Africa's most beautiful landscapes.

Get ready for an unforgettable adventure at The Drop - Oxford, hosted by The Drop on Sunday, February 8, 2026, in the beautiful city of Oxford, Oxfordshire! This exhilarating event is not for the faint-hearted, as it challenges participants to navigate their way back to the event center from a mysterious drop-off location without the aid of modern technology. Choose from two thrilling distances: a 15-mile or a 10-mile journey, and decide whether to tackle this challenge solo or with a team of friends.  
 
Participants will surrender all electronic devices upon registration, receive an emergency bag, and board a bus that will whisk them away to the undisclosed starting point. Once the bus stops, the real adventure begins! With no maps, GPS, or navigational tools allowed, you’ll rely solely on your instincts and determination to find your way back. Only 75 spots are available for this unique test of resilience, so don’t miss your chance to be part of The Drop! Prepare for a day filled with excitement, camaraderie, and the ultimate in outdoor challenges. Are you ready to take the plunge?

raw.full_description:
Get ready for an exhilarating challenge at The Drop – Cambridge, hosted by The Drop on Saturday, February 7th, 2026! This thrilling event offers participants the chance to take on a 15-mile or 10-mile race, either solo or in teams, in what promises to be one of the most unique and demanding races in the UK. Inspired by military-style obstacles, The Drop invites you to step outside of your comfort zone and test your resilience and resourcefulness like never before. 
 
Upon registration, participants will hand over their electronic devices and receive a race number and emergency bag. From there, you'll embark on a mysterious journey as you're transported to an undisclosed drop-off location, where the real adventure begins! With no maps, GPS, or navigational aids, you'll need to rely solely on your instincts to find your way back to the event centre. Whether you choose to run, walk, or crawl, the only rule is to complete the race using your own two legs. Prepare for an unforgettable day filled with excitement, camaraderie, and the ultimate test of your limits at The Drop – Cambridge!
		 
		 Read more
